name: Trivia Quest Trivia Game | Mixed 25 Questions | 25 Questions

questions.text: Name the ring of leather through which a Scout neckerchief is threaded?
What is the national bird of New Zealand?
Name the industrial city in Northwest France which is the capital of the Calvados department.
The gibbon is a small agile ape inhabiting the forests of ... ?
Luanda is the capital of which republic in Southwest Africa?
questions.explanation:
Angola.

	Lusaka is the capital of Zambia. Kampala is the capital of Uganda and Nairobi is the capital of Kenya.

questions.text: Which animal's name is a Spanish word meaning 'a small armored man'?
Name the nationality of the racing driver Juan Manuel Fangio who won the World Championship five times between 1951 and 1957?
Which of the following is NOT an official language of Switzerland?
questions.explanation:
Swiss.

	There is no language called 'Swiss.' The fourth official language is French.

questions.text: How long is the 'San Andreas Fault' in northern California, USA?
The stomach of a human baby is about the size of a chicken egg. Approximately how many pints of liquid can an adult's stomach hold?
Which of the following words are NOT derived from the German language?
questions.explanation:
Bungalow.

	'Bungalow' is derived from the Indian language along with the words 'polo,' 'jungle' and 'shampoo.'

questions.text: When was London's Metropolitan Police Fingerprint Branch set up where in the first six months of operation its three officers made 93 identifications by fingerprints?
How many children did England's Queen Anne (1665-1714) have?
questions.explanation:
17.

	Only one survived infancy, only to die at the age of 12.

questions.text: Name the King of Corinth in Greek Mythology condemned to roll a heavy stone up a hill for eternity?
questions.explanation:
Sisyphus.

	Every time he approached the top, the stone escaped his grasp and rolled to the bottom.

questions.text: What was the first name of the American lexicographer Mr. Webster (1758-1843) who was famous for his 'American Dictionary of the English Language' (1828)?
How many of the following musical instruments belong to the woodwind section: saxophone, flute, recorder, oboe?
questions.explanation:
All of them.

	Not all woodwind instruments are made of wood. Saxophones and most flutes are made of metal whereas some recorders are made of plastic.

questions.text: What sort of creature is a blue hamlet?
questions.explanation:
Fish.

	It is one of the world's most beautiful fish.

questions.text: In which city was the accordion invented?
questions.explanation:
Vienna.

	In Austria in 1829 by Cyrill Damien.

questions.text: In 1876 Alexander Graham Bell spoke his first words over a telephone when he called out to his assistant to come and help him. What had he done?
Written Chinese has no alphabet but is made up of about how many characters?
questions.explanation:
50,000.

	Each character forms a word or part of a word. Chinese children need to learn about 4,000 characters in order to be able to read a book.

questions.text: How many separate bones or vertebrae are there in the backbone or spine of man?
William Herschel from Great Britain discovered Uranus in 1781 and American Clyde Tombaugh discovered Pluto in 1930. What was the nationality of the discoverer of Neptune, Johann Galle in 1846?
How many of these major constellations would you find in the northern hemisphere: 'Draco', 'The Plough' (or Little Bear), 'Orion' (The Hunter), 'Southern Cross'?
questions.explanation:
3.

	The 'Southern Cross' is found in the southern hemisphere. Orion can be seen BOTH in the northern and southern hemisphere. Special thanks to Nickelodeon3, Krita2, TemptressTOO, saruman, mink, JaneDavy and rmatera who corrected me about Orion.

questions.text: Which African flag does NOT feature a shield and spears?
questions.explanation:
Botswana.

	Botswana's flag consists of blue, white and black stripes. The blue stands for rain and the other stripes for black and white people.

questions.text: The Taj Mahal was built by Shah Jahan as a tomb for his wife Mumtaz who died during childbirth. She died giving birth to their _____ child?
questions.explanation:
fourteenth.

	Hope you enjoyed the quiz.
